title: Real data analysis
text: use lithium_battery data example.

title: Real data analysis
text: section, provide tutorial parameter estimates using MLE Bayesian methods. methods integrated sta_infer() function just need set "method".

title: Real data analysis
code: # MLE ======== mle_fit = sta_infer(method = "MLE", process = "Wiener", type = "classical",                     data = lion_battery) mle_fit #>         low   mean     up #> [1,] 0.0024 0.0037 0.0051 #> [2,] 0.0166 0.0176 0.0185 Reliability(t = 100, threshold = lithium_battery[[2]][1],par = mle_fit[,2],             process = "Wiener",type = "classical") #> [1] 0.6161691 Reliability_cowplot(R_time = 1:300, sum_para = mle_fit, threshold = lithium_battery[[2]],                                process = "Wiener", type = "classical") rul2 = RUL(t = 1:100, cur_time = 30, threshold = lithium_battery[[2]][1], data = lithium_battery[[1]], par = mle_fit[,2], process = "Wiener", type = "classical")  RUL_plot(fut_time = c(10,15,20,25,30,50),           time_epoch = 1:30,          group = 1,          process = "Wiener",           type = "classical",          threshold = lithium_battery[[2]][1],          dat = lithium_battery[[1]],          zlim = c(0,0.01),          xlim = c(0,30),          para = mle_fit[,2],          real_RUL=c(NA,NA,NA,NA,NA,NA)) #> $rect #> $rect$w #> [1] 0.3310614 #>  #> $rect$h #> [1] 0.1378301 #>  #> $rect$left #> [1] -0.1409714 #>  #> $rect$top #> [1] 0.301789 #>  #>  #> $text #> $text$x #> [1] -0.05568901 -0.05568901 -0.05568901 #>  #> $text$y #> [1] 0.2673315 0.2328740 0.1984164

title: Simulation data analysis
text: use sim_dat() generate simulated Wiener degradation process, group 6, time epoch t = 1:200. denote parameters \(\mu = 2, \sigma = 3\). output list: () first part list amount degradation simulated data, (ii) second part increment degradation. Using plot_path() function plot simulated degradation data.  object ggplot, can add related function change plot. example, let’s change theme pattern.

title: Simulation data analysis
text: section, provide tutorial parameter estimates using MLE Bayesian methods. methods integrated sta_infer() function just need set "method".

title: Simulation data analysis
text: output MLE dataframe contains point interval estimates.
code: mle_fit = sta_infer(method = "MLE", process = "Wiener", type = "classical", data = dat) mle_fit #>         low   mean     up #> [1,] 1.9338 2.1151 2.2965 #> [2,] 2.7901 2.9183 3.0465

title: Simulation data analysis
text: output Bayes resampling rstan. According object, can process, e.g., prognostic, check .

title: Authors and Citation
text: Liangliang Zhuang. Author, maintainer. Wenhui Wu. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhuang L, Wu W (2023). sdp: Stochastic degradation process. R package version 0.1.0, https://liangliangzhuang.github.io/sdp/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sdp: Stochastic degradation process},   author = {Liangliang Zhuang and Wenhui Wu},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://liangliangzhuang.github.io/sdp/}, }

title: Stochastic degradation process
text: goal sdp provide engineers practical guidance analyze data using common degradation models: Wiener process, Gamma process, Inverse Gaussian process. degradation process, provide data simulation generation, statistical inference, remaining useful life prognostics.

title: Stochastic degradation process
text: can install development version sdp GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("liangliangzhuang/sdp")

title: Stochastic degradation process
text: sdp functions fall five main categories: “Simulation” can simulate group degradation models, see sim_dat(). “Inference” contains maximum likelihood estimator (MLE) Bayesian method, see sta_infer(). “Ploting” contains several visualization functions, mainly plotting degradation paths, reliability remaining useful life. See plot_path(), RUL_plot(), Reliability_plot(), Reliability_cowplot(), RUL_3D_density(). “Others” contains useful functions. See cumsub(), acc_stress().
code: library(sdp) ## basic example code

title: NASA 锂电池数据 — lithium_battery
text: 该数据是 NASA Ames Prognostics Center Fxcellence (PCoF）对商用锂离子 18650 电池进行充、放电试验获得的一组蓄电池容量变化数据。试验过程中，锂离子在室温下 经历 3 种不同的运行剖面，即充电、放电和测量 EIS。 充电是以恒流模式(CC)进行，在 1.5A 电流下直到电池电压达到4.2V，然后以恒压模式(CV)继续充电直到电流降到 20mA。 放电也以恒流模式进行，放电电流为2A，直到电池电压降低到2.7V。 重复充电和放电将导致蓄电池老化。

title: NASA 锂电池数据 — lithium_battery
code: lithium_battery

title: NASA 锂电池数据 — lithium_battery

title: Generate simulated degradation data — sim_dat
text: group number groups products t time. para parameters certain model. process Wiener, Gamma Inverse Gaussian process. type classical default. s stress. rel relationship.

title: Generate simulated degradation data — sim_dat
text: Return list containing simulated data different time points group. output list. first part list amount degradation simulated data, second part increment degradation

title: Statistical inference — sta_infer
text: function used statistical inference model parameters. methods including maximum likelihood estimator Bayesian inference.

title: Statistical inference — sta_infer
code: sta_infer(   method = "MLE",   process = "Wiener",   type = "classical",   data = dat,   p = 0.975,   par = c(1, 1),   chains = 1,   warmup = 1000,   iter = 2000,   cores = 1,   s = NULL,   rel = NULL )

title: Statistical inference — sta_infer
text: method time. process Wiener, Gamma Inverse Gaussian process. type classical default. data degradation data. p default `p=0.975`. par initial parameter. chains default `chains = 1` warmup default `warmup = 1000`. iter default `iter= 2000`. cores cores = 1, s stress. rel relationship.

title: Statistical inference — sta_infer
text: Returns data frame method MLE, returns stan raw results method Bayes.

title: Statistical inference — sta_infer
code: dat <- sim_dat(group = 5, t = 1:200, para = c(2,3), process = "Wiener",type = "classical", s = NULL, rel = NULL) # MLE mle_fit = sta_infer(method = "MLE", process = "Wiener", type = "classical", data = dat) mle_fit #>         low   mean     up #> [1,] 1.7805 1.9702 2.1599 #> [2,] 2.9187 3.0528 3.1869 # Bayes library(rstan) #> Loading required package: StanHeaders #> rstan (Version 2.21.8, GitRev: 2e1f913d3ca3) #> For execution on a local, multicore CPU with excess RAM we recommend calling #> options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores()). #> To avoid recompilation of unchanged Stan programs, we recommend calling #> rstan_options(auto_write = TRUE) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘rstan’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:tidyr’: #>  #>     extract bayes_fit = sta_infer(method = "Bayes", process = "Wiener", type = "classical", data = dat) bayes_fit$summary #>      2.5%   mean  97.5% #> mu 1.7702 1.9673 2.1655 #> w  2.9218 3.0525 3.1865 print(bayes_fit$summary, probs = c(0.025,0.5,0.975),pars = c("mu","w")) #>      2.5%   mean  97.5% #> mu 1.7702 1.9673 2.1655 #> w  2.9218 3.0525 3.1865 plot(bayes_fit$stan_re) #> ci_level: 0.8 (80% intervals) #> outer_level: 0.95 (95% intervals)  # traceplot(bayes_fit$stan_re,pars = c("mu","w"), #            inc_warmup = TRUE,nrow = 1) + #    theme(legend.position = "top")

title: sdp 0.1.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added constant-stress accelerated degradation models.
